diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,15 @@
+<link rel="shortcut icon" href="{{ url_for('static', filename='images/favicon.ico') }}">
+<link href="{{ url_for('static', filename='jquery_ui/jquery-ui.css')}}" rel="stylesheet">
+{% if ui_settings['darkmode'] %}
body:
To prevent code duplication, would it be possible to make the dark mode a separate CSS file that gets loaded on top of the existing CSS file?

Like

include normal css
if darkmode:
    include dark mode css

Where the dark mode css only has the changes to make the UI dark.

diff_hunk:
@@ -121,6 +120,45 @@ def upgrade_device():
     # Reboot
     reboot_device()
 
+def read_ui_settings():
+    ui_hdd_file = '/mnt/hdd/mynode/settings/ui.json'
+    ui_mynode_file = '/home/bitcoin/.mynode/ui.json'
+
+    # read ui.json from HDD
+    if os.path.isfile(ui_hdd_file):
+        with open(ui_hdd_file, 'r') as fp:
+            ui_settings = json.load(fp)
+    # read ui.json from mynode
+    elif os.path.isfile(ui_mynode_file):
+        with open(ui_mynode_file, 'r') as fp:
+            ui_settings = json.load(fp)
+    # if ui.json is not found anywhere, use default settings
+    else:
+        ui_settings = {'darkmode': False}
+
+    return ui_settings
+
+def write_ui_settings(ui_settings):
body: You might want to wrap this in a try since the HDD write will fail if the setting is changed before an HDD is detected.

body:
This doesn't need to be a small tag if it's changed to class="cli_small" Small could be changed to a

or

I didn't introduce #cli_contents
but it's only used in bitcoin-cli page, so it's not a big deal
Ha, OK, then I'm complaining about my own shortcuts and hacks. ;-)
Does this also need to be made in the non-dark version? This is why I was concerned about two CSS files.

I'm not sure if I understand you.
small_message class (which shows the witty quotes) has the default black color in the non-dark version. I'm just changing its color to off-white.
#cli_contents is for displaying the output of CLI commands and few javascript functions are attached to it.

 apt -y -qq install apt-transport-https ca-certificates
 apt -y install libgmp-dev automake libtool libltdl-dev libltdl7
 
+# Install Whirlpool
+apt -y install openjdk-8-jre
+mkdir /opt/mynode/whirlpool
+wget https://github.com/Samourai-Wallet/whirlpool-runtimes/releases/download/cli-0.9.1/whirlpool-client-cli-0.9.1-run.jar /opt/mynode/whirlpool
body:
This `wget` command throws an error: `/opt/mynode/whirlpool: Scheme missing.` 
Just remove the 2nd argument of `wget` and add `cd /opt/mynode/whirlpool` before `wget`.

diff_hunk:
@@ -20,6 +20,11 @@ apt -y install libatlas-base-dev libffi-dev libssl-dev glances python3-bottle
 apt -y -qq install apt-transport-https ca-certificates
 apt -y install libgmp-dev automake libtool libltdl-dev libltdl7
 
+# Install Whirlpool
+apt -y install openjdk-8-jre
+mkdir /opt/mynode/whirlpool
body: Also, add `sudo -u bitcoin` before `mkdir` (and `wget` below) since the Systemd service is owned by 'bitcoin' user. Otherwise CLI won't be able to create state and UTXO files in that folder.

diff_hunk:
@@ -20,6 +20,32 @@ apt -y install libatlas-base-dev libffi-dev libssl-dev glances python3-bottle
 apt -y -qq install apt-transport-https ca-certificates
 apt -y install libgmp-dev automake libtool libltdl-dev libltdl7
 
+# Install Whirlpool
+apt -y install openjdk-8-jre
+
+WHIRLPOOL_UPGRADE_URL=https://github.com/Samourai-Wallet/whirlpool-client-cli/releases/download/0.9.1/whirlpool-client-cli-0.9.1-run.jar}
+WHIRLPOOL_UPGRADE_URL_FILE=/home/bitcoin/.mynode/.whirlpool_url
+CURRENT=""
+if [ -f $WHIRLPOOL_UPGRADE_URL_FILE ]; then
+    CURRENT=$(cat $WHIRLPOOL_UPGRADE_URL_FILE)
+fi
+if [ "$CURRENT" != "$WHIRLPOOL_UPGRADE_URL" ]; then
+        if [ ! -d /opt/mynode/whirlpool ]; then
+            sudo -u bitcoin mkdir -p /opt/mynode/whirlpool
+            cd /opt/mynode/whirlpool
+        else
+            cd /opt/mynode/whirlpool
+            sudo -u bitcoin rm -rf *.jar
+        fi
+        sudo -u bitcoin wget $WHIRLPOOL_UPGRADE_URL
+        sudo -u bitcoin mv whirlpool-client-cli* whirlpool.jar
+
+    mkdir -p /home/bitcoin/.mynode/
+    chown -R bitcoin:bitcoin /home/bitcoin/.mynode/
body: I don't think you need to create this folder. It's already present.
